question: In an LCR series circuit, the value of only capacitance C is varied. The resulting variation of resonance frequency <katex>$f_{0}$</katex> as a function of C can be represented as
explanation: The resonance frequency is given by <katex>$f_0 = \frac{1}{2\pi \sqrt{LC}}$</katex>.
As <katex>$C$</katex> increases, <katex>$f_0$</katex> decreases, but not linearly. The curve is a rectangular hyperbola type shape.
Graph C correctly represents this inverse non-linear relationship.
